void PMHALLP8731LP3907ConfigureRegulatorMap (pmhalLP8731LP3907RegulatorMapPtr_t regulatorMap)
 The PMIC regulator output to the device input mapping can be different on different boards. This API can be used to provide a different mapping to the PMIC driver if the mapping does not

match the default. Example table is shown below:

| Device voltage Rail | Ptr to Regulator |

| PMHAL_PRCM_PMIC_REGULATOR_CORE | PMHAL_LP8731_LP3907_REGULATOR_BUCK1 | | PMHAL_PRCM_PMIC_REGULATOR_DSPEVE| PMHAL_LP8731_LP3907_REGULATOR_BUCK2| | .... | | index (Refer | For index of the | | pmhalPrcmPmicRegulatorId_t) | gPmhalLP8731LP3907Regulator | | | refer |

| | pmhalLP8731LP3907RegulatorId_t |

This table when translated to code is as below: pmhalLP8731LP3907RegulatorMap_t regulatorMap[ PMHAL_PRCM_PMIC_REGULATOR_COUNT] = { { &gPmhalLP8731LP3907Regulator[ PMHAL_LP8731_LP3907_REGULATOR_BUCK1], I2C_INSTANCE, PMIC_I2C_SLAVE_ADDRESS }, { &gPmhalLP8731LP3907Regulator[ PMHAL_LP8731_LP3907_REGULATOR_BUCK2], I2C_INSTANCE, PMIC_I2C_SLAVE_ADDRESS }, ...... };. More...
 

Variables

const pmhalLP8731LP3907RegulatorProp_t gPmhalLP8731LP3907Regulator [PMHAL_LP8731_LP3907_REGULATOR_MAX]
 

Detailed Description

The Power Management IC (PMIC) L8731 specific API definition.

The APIs defined here are to control the voltage of the PMIC rails and to query the status.

Enumeration Type Documentation

enum pmhalLP8731LP3907RegulatorId

Abstract Enumeration for the Regulators.

Enumerator
PMHAL_LP8731_LP3907_REGULATOR_INVALID 

Invalid PMIC regulator ID

PMHAL_LP8731_LP3907_REGULATOR_MIN 

Minimum Abstracted PMIC Regulator ID

PMHAL_LP8731_LP3907_REGULATOR_BUCK1 

Abstracted PMIC Regulator ID for LP8731/LP3907 BUCK 1

PMHAL_LP8731_LP3907_REGULATOR_BUCK2 

Abstracted PMIC Regulator ID for LP8731/LP3907 BUCK 2

PMHAL_LP8731_LP3907_REGULATOR_LDO1 

Abstracted PMIC Regulator ID for LP8731/LP3907 LDO 1

PMHAL_LP8731_LP3907_REGULATOR_LDO2 

Abstracted PMIC Regulator ID for LP8731/LP3907 LDO 2

PMHAL_LP8731_LP3907_REGULATOR_MAX 

Maximum Abstracted PMIC Regulator ID

Function Documentation

void PMHALLP8731LP3907ConfigureRegulatorMap ( pmhalLP8731LP3907RegulatorMapPtr_t  regulatorMap)

The PMIC regulator output to the device input mapping can be different on different boards. This API can be used to provide a different mapping to the PMIC driver if the mapping does not

match the default. Example table is shown below:

| Device voltage Rail | Ptr to Regulator |

| PMHAL_PRCM_PMIC_REGULATOR_CORE | PMHAL_LP8731_LP3907_REGULATOR_BUCK1 | | PMHAL_PRCM_PMIC_REGULATOR_DSPEVE| PMHAL_LP8731_LP3907_REGULATOR_BUCK2| | .... | | index (Refer | For index of the | | pmhalPrcmPmicRegulatorId_t) | gPmhalLP8731LP3907Regulator | | | refer |

| | pmhalLP8731LP3907RegulatorId_t |

This table when translated to code is as below: pmhalLP8731LP3907RegulatorMap_t regulatorMap[ PMHAL_PRCM_PMIC_REGULATOR_COUNT] = { { &gPmhalLP8731LP3907Regulator[ PMHAL_LP8731_LP3907_REGULATOR_BUCK1], I2C_INSTANCE, PMIC_I2C_SLAVE_ADDRESS }, { &gPmhalLP8731LP3907Regulator[ PMHAL_LP8731_LP3907_REGULATOR_BUCK2], I2C_INSTANCE, PMIC_I2C_SLAVE_ADDRESS }, ...... };.

Parameters
regulatorMapPointer to the array of pointers which gives the mapping. The array is defined as above.
Returns
None
const pmhalPmicOperations_t* PMHALLP8731LP3907GetPMICOps ( void  )

Get PMIC ops structure. All the other functions are accessed via function pointers whose array is exported by this function.

Returns
Return pointer to the PMIC ops structure.

Variable Documentation

const pmhalLP8731LP3907RegulatorProp_t gPmhalLP8731LP3907Regulator[PMHAL_LP8731_LP3907_REGULATOR_MAX]

Data structure to describe the properties for all the regulators.
